hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation-Cluster Catalyst Acceleration
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in a BEAR or STRESS regime and a negative catalyst triggers a move that pushes price within 3% of a major liquidation cluster (>$50M in liquidations within 1%), the subsequent break through that cluster will accelerate price movement by 30-50% more than expected, providing a momentum short opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidation clusters act as 'fuel' for price movements. A catalyst that pushes price into this fuel triggers forced liquidations, which then trigger more liquidations (cascade), accelerating the move beyond what the catalyst alone would cause.
entry_conditions: BTC price within 3% of a known liquidation cluster (derived from exchange heatmaps)
Negative catalyst (news, macro) triggers move toward cluster

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 1.5x the distance from entry to cluster level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses and moves >2% away from cluster without breaking it

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Average post-cluster-break acceleration < 20% OR cluster breaks fail to follow catalyst >40% of the time.
